text: Niels Henrik Abel (5 August 1802 â€“ 6 April 1829) was a Norwegian mathematician. He died in 1829. He did the first complete proof demonstrating the impossibility of solving the general quintic equation in radicals. ==Legacy== The Abel Prize (Abel-prisen) is named after him. ==Related pages== *List of scientists from Europe ==References== Category:1802 births Category:1829 deaths Category:19th-century Norwegian people Category:Abel Prize Category:Deaths from tuberculosis Category:Norwegian Lutherans Category:Norwegian mathematicians Category:Scientists from Oslo Category:University of Oslo alumni
title: Niels Henrik Abel
